heh,  you know how I usually play(err used to anyway).  Hire a buttload of soldiers cause,  yea charge rules, and some clericks to keep them healthy, plus a mage or 2.  Then I take my army and get my ass kicked a lot.  I end up keeping a couple soldiers that get burly, and my clerics usually do good at leveling up, and the mages
manage to stay alive by themselves fairly well while I am busy madly charging the enemy.  just have to keep hiring fresh cannon fodder . . . hmm this is probly why I never got a guy over like level 6. . It would be kinda nice to not have to keep "yelling" though so my guys didn't forget that I did a "summon defence" at the beginning.
As far as playing with 4 people, you gotta have a joystick or gamepad or something.  still can't see much though on that screen.

4idlamo@... wrote:

> Man does not live with archmage/mage alone.
> First of all, an introduction (regardless of what my stupid email address is) I (think, but am i?) my name is Trahern, not 4idlamo.
> You spoke of writing fan fic; a concept which calls to the writers of the world to apply their abilities to popular games and shows such as Dragonball Z, Warcraft, Starcraft or in this case, Gladiator.
> As an English major at UofT and a gladiator fan I am more than happy to read/write such stories, however you will find that in a game as simple as Gladiator (sorry Tom) you need to do more than introduce some characters and fill the story with fight scenes.
>
> I tried building some gladiator levels, but my mom got mad at me when I tried to build a mage tower in my backyard. And the bombs did some serious damage to the walls. Funny that's not how it's supposed to happen.
>
> Why are we still stuck with a game that was last released in 1998? Time for some new versions. I couldn't even download Glad5, that .zip link has been broken forever.
> Why is the game called Gladiator at all? Don't most gladiators carry a sword? Oh yeah that's right, those guys with the white helmets have swords. But I just kick their ass with fire elementals and chain lightning.
> Come on guys you really have chars that are lvl 100 + ?
> Is there any point to hiring any class except an archer or mage? If the game is really that easy for you why don't you hire a team with some druids or thieves or orcs?
>
> >From what I can tell (playing two player and or three player mode on slaughter with my brothers)
> Soldier: sword throw is ok, real power is in charge.
> cleric: heals the grunts, makes a base to fight off the pesky baddies.
> mage/archer: hides in base and shoots the enemies.
>
> Those are my three guys for the game. I can't cram a 4th guy at the keyboard, it locks up. :( And I'd need a 60 inch screen to get a good view with the split screen action. Is there any other point to the characters out there? I mean i see these graphics of guys on my screen that aren't on my team, but who cares?
>
> (feel free to tell me how incorrect my judgement is cause it might be interesting to use these guys)
> Thief: bombs = useless; cloak = semi-useless; taunt = ???; gas cloud = unpredictable.
> Elf: wow. rocks. Enough said. and damn slow too.
> Orc: nice howl there pal. Try standing up to Dirk and his elves on lvl 1.
> Orc Capn: nice thief-dagger. You do anything else besides have that nice shoulder armor?
> Barbarian: interesting hammer. Where the boulders coming from? seems like a new soldier without the charge (aka the best move ever)
> Skeleton: like a soldier, but faster. wheres the charge?
> Ghost: way to make the bad guys run, bud.
> Pixie: (see druid) good for freezing really tough badguys maybe.
> Druid: lightning. nice range... and trees make good backbone for a base, but where's the heal? faeries are nice too, but pretty big (small) pushovers.
> Slime: always fun, but you usually get rocked before you can split enough times to fight back. and if your team isn't all slime, it will be soon when your other guys can't get on the field.
> Fire Elemental: well he LOOKS tough. Starburst is nice... I guess... Kind of lame game play if you ask me.
>
> Am I on the mark with this assessment? [Please don't kill me Tom I still think you guys rOOl] If the game is no longer challenging would it be sneaky to get more players and fight over who gets the $ upgrades? maybe play with a bigger team and share the $? Maybe play with characters that don't use teleport?
>
> You guys seemed relaxed and easy going, so I think I can assume a warmer welcome than I got in the ladies change-room. Yeah sure they did a lot of screaming but I figure that's the worst that you guys could do too. It would probably be in caps, not high pitched shreaks. And those high heels can really hurt your eyeballs, you know?
> Just some thoughts.
> -Trahern
